org.eclipselabs.emongo

Interface MongoDatabaseProvider


  • public interface MongoDatabaseProvider
    A MongoDatabaseProvider allows clients to obtain a reference to a MongoDB database without having to understand the configuration of the database. Instances of MongoDatabaseProvider will be registered as an OSGi service. This service allows the database connection to be configured independent of the client code. It is expected that the client code will be aware of the alias to distinguish between multiple databases.
    Author:
    bhunt

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String PROP_ALIAS

      The service property key for the MongoDB client reference filter.
      static java.lang.String PROP_DATABASE
      The service property key for the MongoDB database name when configuring the database provider.
      static java.lang.String PROP_PASSWORD
      The service property key for the MongoDB password when configuring the database provider.
      static java.lang.String PROP_USER
      The service property key for the MongoDB user when configuring the database provider.

      • PROP_ALIAS

        static final java.lang.String PROP_ALIAS
        The service property key for configuring the database alias. The alias value may be used by client code to distinguish between multiple databases.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROP_DATABASE

        static final java.lang.String PROP_DATABASE
        The service property key for the MongoDB database name when configuring the database provider.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROP_USER

        static final java.lang.String PROP_USER
        The service property key for the MongoDB user when configuring the database provider. Used for authentication (optional).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROP_PASSWORD

        static final java.lang.String PROP_PASSWORD
        The service property key for the MongoDB password when configuring the database provider. Used for authentication (optional).
